   20: 
   21: -module(list_bif_SUITE).
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   25:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: -export([hd_test/1,tl_test/1,t_length/1,t_list_to_pid/1,
   27:          t_list_to_ref/1, t_list_to_ext_pidportref/1,
   28:          t_list_to_port/1,t_list_to_float/1,t_list_to_integer/1]).
   29: 
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   33:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   34: 
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [hd_test, tl_test, t_length, t_list_to_pid, t_list_to_port,
   38:      t_list_to_ref, t_list_to_ext_pidportref,
   39:      t_list_to_float, t_list_to_integer].
   40: 
   41: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   42:     Config.
   43: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   44:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   45: 
   46: %% Tests list_to_integer and string:to_integer
   47: t_list_to_integer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   48:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC")),
   49:     12373281903728109372810937209817320981321 = (catch list_to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321")),
   50:     12373 = (catch list_to_integer("12373")),
   51:     -12373 =  (catch list_to_integer("-12373")),
   52:     12373 = (catch list_to_integer("+12373")),
   53:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer(abc)),
   54:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_integer("")),
   55:     {12373281903728109372810937209817320981321,"ABC"} = string:to_integer("12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC"),
   56:     {-12373281903728109372810937209817320981321,"ABC"} = string:to_integer("-12373281903728109372810937209817320981321ABC"),
   57:     {12,[345]} = string:to_integer([$1,$2,345]),
   58:     {error,badarg} = string:to_integer([$1,$2,a]),
   59:     {error,no_integer} = string:to_integer([$A]),
   60:     {error,badarg} = string:to_integer($A),
   61: 
   62:     %% System limit.
   63:     Digits = lists:duplicate(3_000_000, $9),
   64:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = catch list_to_integer(Digits),
   65:     _ = erlang:garbage_collect(),
   66:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = catch list_to_integer(Digits, 16),
   67:     _ = erlang:garbage_collect(),
   68:     {error,system_limit} = string:to_integer(Digits),
   69:     _ = erlang:garbage_collect(),
   70: 
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: %% Test hd/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   74: hd_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   75:     $h = hd(id("hejsan")),
   76:     case catch hd(id($h)) of
   77:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
   78:         Res ->
   79:             ct:fail("hd/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
   80:     end,
   81:     ok.
   82: 
   83: 
   84: %% Test tl/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   85: tl_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   86:     "ejsan" = tl(id("hejsan")),
   87:     case catch tl(id(104)) of
   88:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
   89:             ok;
   90:         Res ->
   91:             ct:fail("tl/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
   92:     end,
   93:     ok.
   94: 
   95: 
   96: %% Test length/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
   97: 
   98: t_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     0 = length(""),
  100:     0 = length([]),
  101:     1 = length([1]),
  102:     2 = length([1,a]),
  103:     2 = length("ab"),
  104:     3 = length("abc"),
  105:     4 = length(id([x|"abc"])),
  106:     6 = length("hejsan"),
  107:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch length(id([a,b|c]))),
  108:     case catch length({tuple}) of
  109:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  110:             ok;
  111:         Res ->
  112:             ct:fail("length/1 with incorrect args succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
  113:     end,
  114:     ok.
  115: 	      
  116: 
  117: %% Test list_to_pid/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  118: 
  119: t_list_to_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     Me = self(),
  121:     MyListedPid = pid_to_list(Me),
  122:     Me = list_to_pid(MyListedPid),
  123:     case catch list_to_pid(id("Incorrect list")) of
  124:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  125:             ok;
  126:         Res ->
  127:             ct:fail("list_to_pid/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  128:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  129:     end,
  130:     ok.
  131: 
  132: %% Test list_to_port/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  133: 
  134: t_list_to_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  135:     Me = hd(erlang:ports()),
  136:     MyListedPid = port_to_list(Me),
  137:     Me = list_to_port(MyListedPid),
  138:     case catch list_to_port(id("Incorrect list")) of
  139:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  140:             ok;
  141:         Res ->
  142:             ct:fail("list_to_port/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  143:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  144:     end,
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: t_list_to_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  148:     Ref = make_ref(),
  149:     RefStr = ref_to_list(Ref),
  150:     Ref = list_to_ref(RefStr),
  151:     case catch list_to_ref(id("Incorrect list")) of
  152:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  153:             ok;
  154:         Res ->
  155:             ct:fail("list_to_ref/1 with incorrect arg succeeded.~n"
  156:                     "Result: ~p", [Res])
  157:     end,
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: %% Test list_to_pid/port/ref for external pids/ports/refs.
  161: t_list_to_ext_pidportref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  162:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  163:     Pid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []),
  164:     Port = hd(rpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
  165:     Ref = rpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []),
  166: 
  167:     PidStr  = pid_to_list(Pid),
  168:     PortStr = port_to_list(Port),
  169:     RefStr  = ref_to_list(Ref),
  170: 
  171:     Pid2  = list_to_pid(PidStr),
  172:     Port2 = list_to_port(PortStr),
  173:     Ref2  = list_to_ref(RefStr),
  174: 
  175:     %% Local roundtrips of externals work from OTP-23
  176:     %% as even though 'creation' is missing in the string formats
  177:     %% we know the 'creation' of the connected node and list_to_* use that.
  178:     true = (Pid =:= Pid2),
  179:     true = (Port =:= Port2),
  180:     true = (Ref =:= Ref2),
  181:     true = (Pid == Pid2),
  182:     true = (Port == Port2),
  183:     true = (Ref == Ref2),
  184: 
  185:     %% And it works when sent back to the same node instance,
  186:     %% which was connected when list_to_* were called.
  187:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Pid, Pid2]),
  188:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Pid, Pid2]),
  189:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Port, Port2]),
  190:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Port, Port2]),
  191:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '=:=', [Ref, Ref2]),
  192:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, '==',  [Ref, Ref2]),
  193: 
  194: 
  195:     peer:stop(Peer),
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: -define(NEW_PID_EXT, 88).
  199: -define(NEW_PORT_EXT, 89).
  200: -define(NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT, 90).
  201: 
  202: %% Copy pid/port/ref but set creation=0
  203: make_0_creation(X) when is_pid(X); is_port(X); is_reference(X) ->
  204:     B = term_to_binary(X),
  205:     Sz = byte_size(B),
  206:     B2 = case B of
  207:              <<131, ?NEW_PID_EXT, _/binary>> ->
  208:                  PreSz = Sz - 4,
  209:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32>> = B,
  210:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  211:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32>>;
  212:              <<131, ?NEW_PORT_EXT, _/binary>> ->
  213:                  PreSz = Sz - 4,
  214:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32>> = B,
  215:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  216:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32>>;
  217:              <<131, ?NEWER_REFERENCE_EXT, Len:16, _/binary>> ->
  218:                  PostSz = Len*4,
  219:                  PreSz = Sz - (4 + PostSz),
  220:                  <<_:PreSz/binary, Cr:32, PostFix:PostSz/binary>> = B,
  221:                  true = (Cr =/= 0),
  222:                  <<B:PreSz/binary, 0:32, PostFix/binary>>
  223:          end,
  224:     binary_to_term(B2).
  225: 
  226: 
  227: %% Test list_to_float/1 with correct and incorrect arguments.
  228: 
  229: t_list_to_float(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     5.89000 = list_to_float(id("5.89")),
  231:     5.89898 = list_to_float(id("5.89898")),
  232:     case catch list_to_float(id("58")) of
  233:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
  234:         Res ->
  235:             ct:fail("list_to_float with incorrect arg succeeded.~nResult: ~p", [Res])
  236:     end,
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: id(I) -> I.
